chapter.title: Scheduling Reconciliation and LiveSync
chapter.para: OpenIDM provides scheduling for operations such as LiveSync and reconciliation. The scheduler's schedule is configured with syntax similar to that of the cron service of many operating systems. OpenIDM's scheduler relies on the Quartz library.

This chapter only describes the use of the scheduler for reconciliation and LiveSync, though the scheduler service of OpenIDM can be used to schedule many events. For a more complete description please see Appendix Scheduled Tasks & Events.

The scheduler is configured by creating a JSON file named conf/[org.forgerock.openidm.]scheduler-schedule-name.json, where [org.forgerock.openidm.] is optional and added automatically when OpenIDM reads the configuration, and schedule-name is the logical name for the scheduled operation, such as reconcile_systemXmlAccounts_managedUser.

section.title: Configuration File
section.para: The scheduler configuration in the file conf/[org.forgerock.openidm.]scheduler-schedule-name.json has the following format.
section.programlisting: { "enabled" : true, "type" : "cron", "startTime" : "(optional) time", "endTime" : "(optional) time", "schedule" : "cron expression", "timeZone" : "(optional) time zone", "invokeService" : "service identifier", "invokeContext" : "service specific context info" }

listitem.para: Specify the time and date in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
The optional properties startTime, endTime, and timeZone can be absent, or empty.

The cron expression is described in http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/docs/tutorials/crontrigger.html and http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/docs/tutorial/TutorialLesson06.html. There are also some examples in Appendix Scheduled Tasks & Events
The "invokeService" service identifier can currently take the following values: "sync" for reconciliation and "provisioner" for LiveSync.
The value for "invokeContext" depends on the value for "invokeService". Possible combinations are:
"source" takes the external resource (here ldap) and the object type (here account) as the value in the form: system/ldap/account.
"mapping" takes the name property of the mapping as configured in sync.json as a configuration.

note.para: A service identifier can be specified without the org.forgerock.openidm. prefix. In other words, "invokeService" : "sync" is equivalent to "invokeService" : "org.forgerock.openidm.sync".

caption.para: The example describes a scheduled reconciliation which is currently not enabled (no scheduled reconciliation will run) and runs every 30 minute, starting on the 0th or 30th minute of the hour.
The example is for a scheduled LiveSync, currently enabled and will be executed every 15 seconds, starting at the 0th, 15th, 30th or 45th second of the minute.
